Most steps should be conducted in ice.
1. Check the accuracy of 100 µL automatic pipette.
If the value is much higher, \[1-14C]acetyl-CoA may be degraded.
2. Prepare blanks, standards and samples in duplicates.
3. Add 0.5 mL tris buffer to each sample.
Finely tune each sample to pH 7.3 with 1 M HCl or 1 M KOH.
5. 0.25 mL sodium tetrathionate solution, and 0.25 mL acetyl-CoA reaction mixture \(should be FRESH).
Example: Take the stock enzyme solution from the refrigerator and
Transfer 20 µL stock solution into a micro
Add 200 µL 2.9 M \(NH4)2SO4 solution into the micro
7. Add 20 µL of enzyme into each tube EXCEPT FOR BLANKS.
Prepare a set of 13x100 mm disposable tubes to contain eluant.
Transfer 1.0 mL of the solution in the assay tube into the anion ex
Flush columns with 0.5 mL D.I. water.
Pipette 0.5 mL elutes into the vials with 10 mL scintillation cocktail and
In the morning of the working day,
Turn on the water bath and centrifuge.
Prepare columns, tubes, racks, and scintillation vials.
Add 50 µL of the serum/bile/lymph into a 2 mL micro
Wash with 50 µL of  D.I. water.

Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 1.2x104 g at 5 oC.
  To
Separate long chain acyl-CNs \(acid-insoluble fraction) from short chain acyl-CNs and free CN \(acid-soluble fraction) by deproteinization.
Medium chain acyl-CNs are partitioned into the two fractions.
Transfer the supernatant to another 2 mL micro

Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 1.2x104 g at 5 oC.
  To repeat separation.
Collect the supernatant to the other 2 mL micro
Precipitate in 100 µL 3.5 M KOH at pH 13.
Incubate the suspension at 60 oC for 30 min.
Neutralize the supernatant with 100 µL 3.5 M KOH.

Centrifuge the supernatant for 10 min at 1.2x104 g.
  To
Prepare 4 sets of tubes for Free CN and acid-soluble CN duplicates.
Transfer the supernatant to this set of tubes.
Measure the final volume of the supernatant \(About 500 µL) by weighing the tubes again.
Pipette 150 µL supernatant into a 12x75 mm tube.
Preparation of acid-soluble CN \(free + short chain acyl-CN)
Pipette 150 µL supernatant into a 12x75 mm tube.
2. Add 100 µL 3.5 M KOH to pH 13.

3. Incubate the solution at 60 oC for 1 h.
  To alkalinize the short chain carnitine to free carnitine
Cool down the solution and neutralize with 200 µL 1 M HCl.
Preparation of acid-insoluble carnitine \(long chain acyl-CN)
Precipitate in 200 µL 3.5 M KOH at pH 13.
Incubate the suspension at 60 oC for 30 min.
3. Incubate the suspension at 60 oC for another 30 min.
Precipitate the protein in the sample
Centrifuge the suspension for 10 min at 1.2x104 g.
Prepare 6 sets of 12x75 mm tubes for acid-insoluble CN duplicates.
7. Transfer the supernatant to another micro
Centrifuge tube and neutralize with 50 µL 1 M KOH.

Centrifuge the suspension for 10 min at 1.2x104 g.
  To
Transfer the supernatant to this set of tubes.
Measure the final volume of the supernatant \(About 1000 µL) by weighing the tubes again.
Take 500 µL supernatant for CN assay.
V. Preparation of blanks and standards
Run the same as samples but DO NOT ADD ENZYME.
By literature, serum total CN is 20-50 µM, i.e., 1-2.5 nmol/50 µL serum.
Free CN:acyl CN ratio is about 2:1.
Add 50 µL standard solutions contain 40, and 100 µM L-CN \(2, 5 nmol) + 150 µL D.I. water.
Standards for acid soluble and acid insoluble CN fractions:
Add 50 µL standard solutions contain 40, and 100 µM L-CN \(2, 5 nmol)

5. Homogenize the tissue in 750 µL D.I. water.
Wash the pestle and the tube with 750 µL D.I. water.
Measure the volume of the homogenized solution \(About 1500 µL).
Add 750 µL of the homogenizing solution into a 12x75 mm disposable tube.
Add 100 µL ice-cold 1M HClO4 \(200 µL if not duplicated).

Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 1.2x104 g at 5 oC.
  To
Separate long chain acyl-CNs \(acid-insoluble fraction) from short chain acyl-CNs and free CN \(acid-soluble fraction) by deproteinization.
Medium chain acyl-CNs are partitioned into the two fractions.
Transfer the supernatant to another 12x75 mm tube.
Combine the supernatant from the duplicates.
Precipitate in 200 µL 3.5 M KOH at pH 13.
Incubate the suspension at 60 oC for 30 min.
Neutralize the supernatant with 215 µL 1 M KOH.

Centrifuge the supernatant for 10 min at 1.2x104 g.

Prepare 4 sets of tubes for Free CN and acid-soluble CN duplicates.
Transfer the supernatant to this set of tubes.
Measure the final volume of the supernatant \(About 1250 µL) by weighing the tubes again.

3. Weigh the tube with a Teflon cap.
Add 200-300 mg minced tissue into the tube.
Use a cotton applicator to clear the sample on the mouth of the tube before weighing.
4. Add 300 µL 3.5 M KOH at pH 13.

Transfer the supernatant to another set of 13x100 mm tubes.

  To
Prepare another set of 12x75 mm tubes.
